clinical_study.brief_title: Bacteriological Study of Diabetic Foot and Antibiotic Sensitivity Pattern in Eastern India
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational, Prospective, Multicentre Study in Eastern India to Understand the Bacteriological Epidemiology in Diabetic Foot and Sensitivity Pattern of Antibiotics Along With the Pattern of Empirical Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The pattern of organism causing diabetic foot infection are presumed to vary from location to location depending on the antibiotic prescription practice, geographical locations, environmental variations and therapeutic interventions for various patients. Our hypothesis is look to finding out common similarities with diversified subgroups spread across various geographical locations of eastern part of India, thus to create a data base for treating patient with diabetic foot infections.The sensitivity pattern is anticipated to be different from institution to institutions and place to place but the gross sensitivity data of local pathogen could guide physician for choosing right empirical antibiotic. Practice guideline could be postulated from the collated data of distribution of pathogens, their sensitivity pattern as well as co-morbid conditions of the sufferers.

primary_outcome.measure: Epidemiological pattern of diabetic foot infection in eastern India
Sensitivity of isolated organisms to antibiotics
Risk factors associated with different grades of severity of DFI

secondary_outcome.measure: To record prevailing management practices of diabetic foot infection in terms of disease, antibiotic practice, practice of supportive and surgical care.
Common empiric antibiotic therapies used in management of DFI
Percentage sensitivity to different empiric antibiotics

study_pop.textblock: Mixed-Rural/Urban in three eastern states of India

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diabetic foot patients with Wagner's grade 2 or more foot infection.
